samples.question: [Transcript chunk 2]
samples.transcript: Attic Loft conversion in a four-story house in central London fantastic and why do you like London again it is vibrancy there is always something happening London's never dull the city never sleeps there is rich in arts music history there is so much culture on offer which I absolutely love it keeps me interested in London which is why I have remained there for 12 years I only ever wanted to live there for a year but once you are in London it is very hard to leave absolutely I totally agree is there anything you do not like about your city sometimes it can be too busy so for years I lived in central London you would step out of your front door and it is chaotic now I live in a quieter area which I very much appreciate after a busy day in the office and it is a very fast pace of life sometimes I like to slow down but London is always going at full speed wonderful thank you very much.

samples.question: [Transcript chunk 3]

samples.question: [Transcript chunk 6]
samples.transcript: Move on to the topic of environment do you think that climate change is a big issue at the moment it is I mean you only have to look at the current Heat Wave we are experiencing in England which is unheard of yeah it is cooler here at the moment as in England I think we are supposed to hit 38 degrees on Monday there is recently been a big fire which is you know again not something we are used to absolutely in England but yeah it is a real problem there is no escaping it it is everywhere you at the moment there is no denying that we all need to act and do something to try and prevent further damage before it is too late you know it is a real Turning Point at the moment I could talk a lot about sustainability and again through my work we are a green sustainable institution and it is very much at the Forefront of My Mind on a on a daily basis yes absolutely yeah I can imagine so you talk about the steps that people should take what would you recommend that an individual can do to help solve the problem of climate change I think people have to realize that it is our problem it is a shared problem and if we all can make small changes it will make a big difference so I think it is considering your your daily habits considering things that you can do differently rather than you know consuming so much plastic switch to a different material I no longer use plastic bottles or plastic cups biodegradable sponges for washing up just do your research it is very fulfilling and rewarding knowing that you are making a small difference and that is all it needs to be I went to a festival recently.

samples.question: [Transcript chunk 7]
samples.transcript: And there was things like you know no Glitter at the festival it had to be biodegradable and a lot of festivals in England now are publishing guidance as to how they are ensuring that their festivals are sustainable and ways in which you can ensure that as a visitor you are acting in a sustainable way so I think it is small changes we can all make thank you we should be making yes fantastic and just to finish today on the topic of changes how do you think travel will change in the future I think travel has already changed I think the pandemic has made us rethink travel there is certainly it is less accessible I feel at the moment purely because of for example in England at the moment as a real staff shortage so travel's changed whereby queues are longer it took me four hours where it would usually take two hours to get through check-in security Etc I think travel has changed also in a way that people are more conscious of their carbon footprint again back to the topic of sustainability I think people are more conscious as to how far they are flying how frequently and I think the pandemic and the use of technology has also changed travel I think you know there is there is a lot to be had by being in the country but certainly we have done a lot that my university for creating virtual experiences so virtual field trips to particular countries for students to still be able to interact and engage in various means but by not visiting the country but I think you know travel is constantly changing and evolving and the pandemic has had a huge impact on that brilliant thank you very much well done.

samples.question: [Transcript chunk 4]
samples.transcript: Would visit our local pub from time to time and frequenting our local haunt truly became our favorite pastime as we grew into adults together we both had a very similar sense of humor and often we would spend evenings laughing the hours away together and I remember one particular evening where we were sitting and watching YouTube videos and tick tocks as we would often do and we found one that made us both laugh so much that I truly cried my eyes out and she laughed so hard that her tea actually came out of her nose this is such a wonderful memory and I often think about it when I am sad because it has such sentimental value to me and I will never let her live it in the future I will try my best to convince her to come and visit me here in Ho Chi Minh City so that we can make more wonderful memories together thank you so much excellent well done so Harvey thank you so much I thoroughly enjoyed your part two there listening to your childhood friends and your stories really brought tear to my eye now if you are happy.

samples.question: [Transcript chunk 5]
samples.transcript: Yeah yeah I can drop them a message give them a call and they will always be there to listen to me however there are of course friends that I have lost along the way who we have fallen out of touch but sometimes it is nice to reconnect thank you about them what do you think of communicating online via social media I must confess I am not the biggest fan of communicating online however I do appreciate the need for it yeah I live very very far away now from all of my friends and it is an excellent wonderful way for me to communicate with them when I need to for example just last night I spent two hours on Facebook calls with a very close friend of mine from I am curious is there another side to that you say that it is positives but are there any negatives to it I think that is an excellent question it is hard to get a true emotion through and to really understand the Nuance of what someone is saying when communicating online especially over text and that is why I prefer to see people face to face yeah it is true having that face-to-face interaction is something you cannot put a price on is not it excellent modern.

samples.question: Where Do You Live?

samples.question: Do you study your work?
samples.transcript: Well, I am still a student. I have recently passed out my 12th from CBSE board and looking forward for further studies. Ok. Now some questions will be based on evening time.
samples.transcript_original: Well, I am still a student. I have recently passed out my 12th from CBSE board and looking forward for further studies. Ok. Now some questions will be based on evening time.

samples.question: Do You Like the Morning and Evening?
samples.transcript: Well, I am able to wake up early at the morning. So, I prefer evenings as this is the best time to relax and roam around in the garden adore the beauty of the nature and unwind myself.
samples.transcript_original: Well, I am able to wake up early at the morning. So, I prefer evenings as this is the best time to relax and roam around in the garden adore the beauty of the nature and unwind myself.
samples.transcript_cleaned: I am able to wake up early at the morning. So, I prefer evenings as this is the best time to relax and roam around in the garden adore the beauty of the nature and unwind myself.

samples.question: Okay, what do you usually do in the evening?
samples.transcript: During evening, it is my relaxing time. I go for a walk, spend time with my friends and even families and have talk with my friends. So before proceeding further to this interview here I would like to inform you guys at your IS partner platform we are offering online classes for IELTS if you guys wish to enroll in reading speaking listening or writing classes then you can you can contact us on the number displayed below first of all you can book free demo class and later on you can enroll in our courses thank you so much what did you do in the evening when you were little well as I was a child I was busy easily doing my homework playing with my friends during the evening. I had no time for other stuff. And I usually prefer watching TV. Am.
